Package com.jimmyselectronics.nightingale

Class Key

java.lang.Object
com.jimmyselectronics.AbstractDevice<KeyListener>
com.jimmyselectronics.nightingale.Key
public class Key extends AbstractDevice<KeyListener>
Represents a key on a physical keyboard. Keys can be pressed (down) or released (up).
Author:
Jimmy's Electronics LLP

  • Method Details

    • press

      public void press() throws DisabledException
      Simulates pushing (and holding) this key. Requires power.
      Throws:
      DisabledException - if the key is disabled.
      See Also:
      • release()

    • release

      public void release() throws DisabledException
      Simulates letting go of this key, allowing it to return to the unpressed state. Requires power.
      Throws:
      DisabledException - if the key is disabled.
      See Also:
      • press()

    • isPressed

      public boolean isPressed()
      Checks whether this key is currently pressed.
      Returns:
      true if the key is pressed; otherwise, false.

    • deregister

      public boolean deregister(KeyListener listener)
      Description copied from class: AbstractDevice
      Locates the indicated listener and removes it such that it will no longer be informed of events from this device. If the listener is not currently registered with this device, calls to this method will return false, but otherwise have no effect. Does not require power.
      Overrides:
      deregister in class AbstractDevice<KeyListener>
      Parameters:
      listener - The listener to remove.
      Returns:
      true if the listener was found and removed, false otherwise.

    • deregisterAll

      public void deregisterAll()
      Description copied from class: AbstractDevice
      All listeners registered with this device are removed. If there are none, calls to this method have no effect.
      Overrides:
      deregisterAll in class AbstractDevice<KeyListener>

    • plugIn

      public void plugIn()
      Description copied from class: AbstractDevice
      Connects this device to the electrical power grid, leaving the power turned off. If the device is already plugged in or if its power is already turned on, this method does nothing.
      Overrides:
      plugIn in class AbstractDevice<KeyListener>

    • unplug

      public void unplug()
      Description copied from class: AbstractDevice
      Disconnects this device from the electrical power grid. If the device is already disconnected, this method does nothing.
      Overrides:
      unplug in class AbstractDevice<KeyListener>
